data.title: The Best Shahid Kapoor Movies
data.meta_description: Over 1K filmgoers have voted on the 20+ films on Best Shahid Kapoor Movies. Current Top 3: Jab We Met, Chup Chup Ke, Vivah
data.text:
Ranked By

7.7K votes

1.3K voters

Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

List of the best Shahid Kapoor movies, ranked best to worst with movie trailers when available. Shahid Kapoor's highest grossing movies have received a lot of accolades over the years, earning millions upon millions around the world. The order of these top Shahid Kapoor movies is decided by how many votes they receive, so only highly rated Shahid Kapoor movies will be at the top of the list. Shahid Kapoor has been in a lot of films, so people often debate each other over what the greatest Shahid Kapoor movie of all time is. If you and a friend are arguing about this then use this list of the most entertaining Shahid Kapoor films to end the squabble once and for all.

If you think the best Shahid Kapoor role isn't at the top, then upvote it so it has the chance to become number one. The greatest Shahid Kapoor performances didn't necessarily come from the best movies, but in most cases they go hand in hand.

List films include Chup Chup Ke, Vivah and more.

"This list answers the questions, "What are the best Shahid Kapoor movies?" and "What are the greatest Shahid Kapoor roles of all time?"

Satish Kaushik and Yash Chopra have both worked with Shahid Kapoor over the years, as have plenty of other well-known directors.

1

Jab We Met

Kareena Kapoor, Tarun Arora, Dara Singh Randhawa

Released : 2007

Directed by : Imtiaz Ali

Aditya, a heartbroken tycoon on the verge of committing suicide, aimlessly boards a train. He meets Geet, a high-spirited girl who plans to elope with her lover, and finds himself pulled into her crazy life.

2

Shahid Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor, Sunil Shetty

Released : 2006

Directed by : Priyadarsan

A street hustler (Shahid Kapoor), decides to fake his own death so that his family will be able to pay off his debts with the insurance money. When two fishermen find him entangled in their nets, he pretends to be a deaf-mute so that he will not accidentally give away his true identity.

3

Shahid Kapoor, Amrita Rao, Anupam Kher

Released : 2006

Directed by : Sooraj R. Barjatya

Harishchandra (Anupam Kher) is a widower raising his sons, Sunil (Samir Soni) and Prem (Shahid Kapoor). As they grow up, Sunil gets married, while the younger Prem continues his studies before being matched with Poonam (Amrita Rao), who lost her parents at a young age. Following some awkward initial interactions, the young couple begin having feelings for each other, and a wedding is planned. However, after Prem returns from a business trip in Japan, a tragic accident puts everything in doubt.

4

Akshaye Khanna, Shahid Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor

Released : 2006

Directed by : Abbas Alibhai Burmawalla

When Sonia Chang (Payal Rohatgi), a wealthy casino owner in Goa, India, is found dead in her luxurious home at 36 China Town, Chief Inspector Karan (Akshaye Khanna) investigates. After discovering that Chang's young son is missing, Karen becomes frustrated. Worse yet, at every turn he finds a new suspect -- from gorgeous dancer Priya (Shahid Kapoor) to gambler Natwar (Kareena Kapoor) and his alluring wife, Gracy (Paresh Rawal) -- each with a compelling reason to want Chang dead.

5

Shahid Kapoor, Amrita Rao, Satish Shah

Released : 2003

Directed by : Ken Ghosh

Ishq Vishk is a 2003 Bollywood coming-of-age romance film starring Shahid Kapoor in his debut film performance, Amrita Rao and Shenaz Treasurywala. It is about Rajiv and Payal who are friends since childhood. While Payal is in love with Rajiv, it takes him a bit longer to return her feelings. The film became a success and launched both Shahid Kapoor's career and Amrita Rao's career.

6

Priyanka Chopra, Shahid Kapoor, Amole Gupte

Released : 2009

Directed by : Vishal Bhardwaj

Kaminey is a 2009 Indian caper thriller film directed by Vishal Bhardwaj and featuring Shahid Kapoor, Priyanka Chopra and Amol Gupte in the lead roles. Set against the backdrop of the Mumbai underworld, Kaminey follows a rivalry between a pair of twins, one with a lisp and the other with a stutter, over the course of a single day. Bhardwaj co-wrote the screenplay with Sabrina Dhawan, Abhishek Chaubey, and Supratik Sen. Bhardwaj bought the original script for US$4,000 from Kenyan writer Cajetan Boyâ€”whom he had mentored at a scriptwriting workshop in Uganda. Kaminey was released on 14 August 2009 and became a box-office success worldwide, grossing over 710 million against a budget of 350 million. The film's soundtrack album also became a commercial success, with the song "Dhan Te Nan" topping the charts on various platforms. Kaminey was well-received, with several critics and media publications placing it at number one on their listings of "Best film of the year". Since its release, the film has attained cult status. It received several awards and nominations at ceremonies across India.
